title: 106_hr3842
content: The Act titled "Postmasters Fairness and Rights Act" mandates that postmasters are covered by agreements regarding pay policies, schedules, and fringe benefit programs. The Postmasters Fairness and Rights Act requires the Postal Service to propose changes in pay policies, schedules, and fringe benefit programs for postmasters within 45 days of reaching a collective bargaining agreement. The Postal Service and postmasters' organization(s) must work to resolve any differences within 60 days of the proposal submission. The Postmasters Fairness and Rights Act mandates the Postal Service to propose pay policy changes for postmasters within 45 days of a collective bargaining agreement. If no agreement is reached within 60 days, either party can refer the dispute to an arbitration board consisting of 3 members. The arbitration board, appointed within 5 days of the first meeting, will make a conclusive decision within 45 days. Costs are shared equally between the Postal Service and postmasters' organization. The arbitration board will make a conclusive decision within 45 days, with costs shared equally between the Postal Service and postmasters' organization. Nothing in this subsection will affect the application of section 1005. SEC. 3. RIGHT OF POSTMASTERS' ORGANIZATIONS TO PARTICIPATE IN PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT OF PROGRAMS. The amendment allows postmasters' organizations to be included in planning and development programs. SEC. 4. POSTMASTERS AND POSTMASTERS' ORGANIZATION DEFINED. SEC. 4 defines 'postmaster' as an individual managing a post office and 'postmasters' organization' as a group with at least 20% of postmasters as members. SEC. 5. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amends sections 1001(e) and 1003(a) of title 39, United States Code. SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments made by this Act will take effect after a 90-day period from the date of enactment.
